Name: Cafebre
Description: Place for amazing coffee
Address: Calle de Manuel Bravo 108, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Casa Oaxaca
Description: Traditional dishes with the best view of the city
Address: Calle de Manuel García Vigil 407, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Hierba Dulce
Description: Great vegetarian place for breakfast or lunch
Address: Calle Porfirio Díaz 311, Centro

Name: Pan:Am
Description: Amazing bakery with great breakfast
Address: Calle de Mariano Abasolo 111, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Pitiona
Description: International food with a Oaxacan touch
Address: Allende 114 Col. Centro, Oaxaca de Juárez, C.P. 68000

Name: Mercado 20 de Noviembre
Description: Delicious for the masses. You will probably be sharing a table so remember to say provecho when the food arrives
Address: 20 de Noviembre 512, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Zandunga
Description: Istmeño dishes that show off the foodways of the Istmo region of Oaxaca
Address: Calle de Manuel García Vigil 512-E, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Azucena
Description: In the city center, accessible and delicious. Check out the art gallery while you wait
Address: Calle Macedonio Alcalá 303, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Boulenc
Description: Delicious bread and sandwiches
Address: 207 Porfirio Diaz, Oaxaca de Juarez, Mexico 68000

Name: Casa Estambul
Description: They have food, but this place comes alive at night.
Address: Ignacio Allende 316, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Gourmand Delicatessen
Description: A deli and brew pub with Wisconsin-Oaxacan roots.
Address: Calle Porfirio Díaz 410A, RUTA INDEPENDENCIA, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Itanoni
Description: Learn more about corn varieties then you ever wanted to know and enjoy a great meal.
Address: Av Belisario Domínguez 513, Reforma, 68050 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: La Biznaga
Description: Regionally inspired dishes with a nice atmosphere
Address: Calle Manuel Garcia Vigil 512, Oaxaca 68000, Mexico

Name: La Casa del Tio Guerro
Description: Vegetarian friendly
Address: General Calle de Manuel García Vigil 715, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Mexico

Name: La Mezcalerita
Description: Great rooftop for drinks at sunset. Fantastic selection of craft beers from Oaxaca.
Address: Calle Macedonio Alcalá, Centro

Name: Nueva Babel
Description: Small bar with live music. Very laid back.
Address: Calle del General Porfirio Diaz, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Origen
Description: Locally-sourced food reflecting the culture of Oaxaca
Address: Miguel Hidalgo 820, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Sabina Sabe
Description: Good selection of Mezcal and late night food.
Address: 5 de Mayo 209, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Tlacolula de Matamoros
Description: One of the oldest markets in Oaxaca. A fun, must see about 30 km from Oaxaca City.
Address: 70400 int mercado municipal, 70400 Tlacolula de Matamoros, Oax., Mexico

Name: Tobaziche
Description: Tapas and good selection of mescal
Address: 5 de Mayo 311, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: El Olivo
Description: Tapas and good selection of mescal, founders from Wisconsin
Address: Calle La Constitucion 207 , Centro, Oaxaca 68000, Mexico

Name: Mama Pacha
Description: Tiny artesian chocolate maker. You can see the process happen in their store or buy their chocolates all around town.
Address:
Porfirio Díaz 816A, 68000
Oaxaca de Juárez,
México.

Name: Mezza Luna
Description: An Italian gem in the center of Oaxaca with a good wine selection and spectacular view of the city.
Address: Ignacio Allende &, Calle de Manuel García Vigil 113, Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Oax., Mexico

Name: Molino Mayordomo
Description: Best known chocolate shop in Oaxaca. Here you can get freshly made chocolate and mix in nuts, sugar, and/or spices during the milling process. Its worth checking out for the smell.
Address: Francisco Javier Mina 219, Centro, Oaxaca, Mexico

Name: Nieves Manolo
Description: Ice cream. Andrea says its a must.
Address: Calle Macedonio Alcalá 706, Col. Centro, 68000 Oaxaca, Mexico

Name: La Jicara
Description: Bohemian bookstore and art space with a delicious vegetarian menu. Taquitos de Jamaica are a must. There is often live music so its a fun bet any day of the week.
Address: ​Porfirio Diaz 1105 colonia Luis Jimenez Figueroa, Oaxaca 68070 Mexico

Name: Boulenc
Description: Delicious baked goods (especially the almond croissant) and superb molletes. They don't accept reservations and its usually crowded so go early, late or at an odd hour.
Address: Calle Porfirio Díaz 207, Centro

Name: Santisima Flor de Lupulo
Description: Nano-brewery where you can get a flight of delicious beer. Jorge, the brewmaster, will give you a tour if you ask.
Address: Calle Porfirio Díaz 410A, Centro
